facts.1: National PTSD Awareness Day was established by the U.S. Senate in 2010.
facts.2: PTSD affects approximately 3.5% of U.S. adults every year.
facts.3: The day aims to raise awareness about PTSD and encourage those affected to seek help.

facts.1: National Sunglasses Day is celebrated to highlight the importance of wearing UV-protective eyewear.
facts.2: Sunglasses can block up to 99% of UVA and UVB rays.
facts.3: The Vision Council started promoting National Sunglasses Day to educate the public about eye health.

facts.1: Helen Keller Day commemorates the birth of Helen Keller on June 27, 1880.
facts.2: Helen Keller was the first deaf-blind person to earn a Bachelor of Arts degree.
facts.3: The day celebrates her achievements and advocacy for people with disabilities.
